Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; FAYENCE; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Shabti of Masaharte
Description: This blue faience shabti bears the name of the First Prophet of Amun, Masaharta, son of King Pinudjem I. The figure has a headband that is tied at the back of the head, a characteristic of shabtis from the 21st and 22nd Dynasties. The piece comes from the Deir el-Bahari cachette.
